bibl.title: Letter from Lawrence Reed to Emilie Lawrence Reed, August 26, 1900

div1.p: Lawrence Reed is well situated in his new company. He thanks his mother for the gift of an officer's sword.

div1.head: Letter from Lawrence Reed to Emilie Lawrence Reed, August 26, 1900
div1.opener:
Rawell Barracks,
Aug. 26th 1900
Mr Humber sends his
best regards to you
B.& Father-
My dear Mother:-
div1.p:
I received your
sweet letter on Thursday and
Father's this morning, and I
was real glad to hear from
you both as it wasthey were the first
I had had since I left
Havana, I also received a
letter from Allern and Co stating
that they had shipped my sword
so I will thank you in
advance for your thoughtful
but sweeter gift and I shall
ever endevor to do nothing to
cause it to be taken from me.

I am so pleased with my
new station and regiment that
I cant express my feelings

I am living with Cooke
and Humur, they are two
fine fellows and I could
not find nicer fellows' to
live with, moreover every one
of the officers thave been most
kind to me and as I said in my
last letter I am perfectly happy.

Rourn Barracks is most pleasantly
situated on the Cienfuegos harbor and is
a lovely spot, we have nice times going
in bathing in our big bath house and
pass the evenings singing and playing
various instruments nearly every one can
either sung or play. Mrs Hays the Major's
wife is a charming woman & plays the
piano beautifully, We have what is
known as the regimental mess, and
I must say we live far better than most
families do in Cuba. and very inexpensive
as soon as I pay up my debts & etc
there are a few things I want you to
buy for me. but will tell you of them
later, well I will tell you more
next time give my best love to all tell
B to write and thanking you again for
the sword I am with love your aff son
